intro: Stenophyllus warei, commonly known as the African snowflake, is a flowering plant native to the highlands of Ethiopia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features narrow, linear leaves that are arranged in a rosette pattern, giving it a distinctive appearance. It produces small, white to pale blue flowers that bloom in late winter to early spring. Stenophyllus warei is adapted to cool, moist environments and is often found growing in rocky or mountainous regions.
